question: If excessive amounts of metal in or on a building become energized and could be subject to personal contact, which of the following will provide additional safety measures:
An outlet for specific appliances, including laundry equipment, must be located within how many mm of the appliance:
Upon completion of construction or the conclusion of the purpose for which it was installed, temporary wiring shall be removed within which of the following time frames:

options.b: 60 days after the conclusion of an event or construction

question: A traveling cable shall be allowed to run without using a raceway under which of the following conditions:

options.a: The distance from the first point support does not exceed 6 feet.
options.b: The conductors are grouped and taped together.
options.c: The conductors are in their original sheath.

question: Conductors that supply a fire pump motor must have a rating not less than ____ percent of the sum of the fire pump motor's full load current and ____ percent of any associated fire pump accessory equipment:
The antenna for a satellite system must be grounded to which of the following:

options.a: Interior metal water piping system, within 5 feet from its point of entrance
options.b: The building or structure grounding electrode system
options.c: An accessible means external to the building

question: Type UF cable shall be used for which of the following applications:
Service disconnect means shall clearly indicate which of the following:

options.a: The minimum and maximum voltage rating
options.b: If it is in the open or closed position

correct_answer_text: If it is in the open or closed position

question: The total connected load in watts of three electric heaters rated 1000 watts and 1100 watts at 120 volts and 800 watts at 240 volts is:
A continuous load is one in which the maximum current is expected to continue for at least which of the following:
When installing rigid metal conduit (RMC), there cannot be more than the equivalent of four quarter bends (360 degrees) between which of the following:
A nonmetallic wireway is not permitted in which of the following locations unless it is specifically marked otherwise:

options.a: Where the wireway would be exposed to sunlight

correct_answer_text: Where the wireway would be exposed to sunlight

question: Feeders that contain a common neutral are permitted to supply which of the following:

options.a: One, two or three sets of 3-wire feeders

question: Disregarding any exceptions, a conductor rated 56 amperes shall be protected by a fuse sized at which of the following:
Light and power systems conductors 600 volts or less may occupy the same enclosure only when all of the conductors meet which of the following requirements:

options.a: All of the conductors are insulated.
options.b: All conductors are insulated to meet the maximum temperature rating for the enclosure.
options.c: All conductors are insulated for the maximum voltage applied to any conductor in the enclosure.

correct_answer_text: All conductors are insulated for the maximum voltage applied to any conductor in the enclosure.

question: Nine 8.0 sq mm THHN copper conductors in a conduit at 30 degrees C have a maximum allowable ampacity of which of the following:

The minimum individual amperes for two hot, ungrounded feeder circuit conductors running to a commercial building that has a general lighting load of 50,000 volt amperes, supplied by a single phase, 240 volt feeder circuit is closest to which of the following:
Disregarding any exceptions, a copper-clad aluminum conductor used for overhead services must be at least which of the following sizes:
A multi-wire branch circuit that supplies more than one device on the same yoke in a dwelling unit must be protected by which of the following:

options.b: Two single-pole circuit breakers that are tied together
options.c: Two single-pole circuit breakers that operate independently

correct_answer_text: Two single-pole circuit breakers that are tied together

question: Which of the following receptacles may be connected to small appliance circuits:

options.a: A garage ceiling receptacle for a garage door opener
options.b: A living room receptacle for a television set
options.c: A receptacle in the kitchen for an electric clock

correct_answer_text: A receptacle in the kitchen for an electric clock

question: A circuit conductor that is intentionally grounded is which of the following:
The maximum total voltage drop of two feeders and three branch circuits to the farthest outlet in a wiring system should not exceed which of the following:
Class II locations are considered hazardous because which of the following is present in quantities sufficient to create the potential for combustion:
Each kitchen in a two-family dwelling unit requires a minimum of which of the following in order to meet the small appliance load:
Flexible cords are not allowed for use in which of the following locations:

options.a: To replace fixed wiring of a structure

correct_answer_text: To replace fixed wiring of a structure

question: Grounding electrodes perform which of the following functions:

options.a: Prevent current flow into the earth
options.c: Return neutral current to the earth
options.d: Make an electrical connection to the earth

correct_answer_text: Make an electrical connection to the earth

question: The function of a supplementary overcurrent protective device is best described by which of the following statements:

options.a: Is not a substitute for branch circuit overcurrent protection
options.b: Is required to be installed in light fixtures
options.c: Must be installed in any branch circuit system
options.d: Shall not required on circuits rated more than 50 amps

correct_answer_text: Is not a substitute for branch circuit overcurrent protection

question: Which of the following colors of insulation or marking are permitted to identify "hot" phase conductors in conduit wiring methods?

options.a: Black, red, and blue for 120/208-volt systems
options.b: Yellow, orange, and brown for 277/480-volt systems
options.c: Any colors except white, gray, or green

question: Electrical motors with the highest voltage rating are used for which of the following purpose(s)?

options.a: To produce the maximum possible power from the motors
options.c: To reduce the size of the supply conductors required

correct_answer_text: To reduce the size of the supply conductors required

question: Low voltage equipment in a hospital that comes in frequent contact with people's bodies must be which of the following:

options.a: Able to operate at an electrical potential of 10 volts or less

question: If an outlet is in an underfloor raceway and is disconnected, then which of the following actions must be taken on the circuit conductors supplying the outlet:

options.a: A blank cover plate installed on the outlet box

question: Other than service conductors, conductors shall not be installed in the same service raceway unless they are which of the following:
Overcurrent devices in dwelling units and hotel guest rooms shall not be located in which of the following areas:
In order to balance a 3-wire, single-phase 230/115 volt circuit, which of the following must be done:

options.a: The neutral conductor must carry the unbalanced current.
options.b: The hot conductor must carry the total current.
options.c: The neutral conductor should be used for grounding only.

correct_answer_text: The neutral conductor must carry the unbalanced current.

question: In fixed electric space heating equipment, a disconnection means shall be provided from all ungrounded conductors to which of the following equipment components:
Computation of fluorescent fixture loads shall be based on which of the following:

options.a: The total ampere rating of the fixture
options.b: The total wattage of the lamps
options.c: The total volts of the wiring system

correct_answer_text: The total ampere rating of the fixture

question: Parallel conductors in each phase or neutral shall be which of the following:

options.a: The same length and terminated in the same manner

correct_answer_text: The same length and terminated in the same manner

question: If single conductors are not installed in a raceway and stacked longer than 2 feet without maintaining spacing, then which of the following is true:

options.a: The ampacity of each conductor shall be increased
options.b: The ampacity of each conductor shall be reduced
options.c: The conductor must increase to the next size up

correct_answer_text: The ampacity of each conductor shall be reduced

question: NM cable installations shall conform to which of the following:

options.a: It may be covered with plaster
options.b: It may be fished through air voids In masonry block or tile walls

correct_answer_text: It may be fished through air voids In masonry block or tile walls

question: The ampacity of multiconductor cables installed in a cable tray shall be derated based on which of the following:

options.a: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable
options.b: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable tray

correct_answer_text: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable tray

question: Switching should be done in which of the following:
Fuses must be clearly marked with which of the following:

options.c: Interruption rating, if other than 10,000 amperes

question: Type FCC cables shall be clearly and permanently marked with which of the following:
Grounded interior wiring shall not be permitted to be connected to a power supply unless the supply system contains a corresponding conductor that is which of the following:
Even if an outlet box is listed and marked by the manufacturer as suitable to be used as the sole support for a fixture, the fixture shall not weigh more than which of the following:
A 20 ampere rated branch circuit in the living room of a dwelling unit shall be permitted to carry a maximum load of which of the following:
A service mast used to support service drop conductors shall be supported by which of the following:
A transformer enclosure that extends directly to an underwater pool light and forms a shell must have which of the following:

options.c: The number of conduit entries plus one

correct_answer_text: The number of conduit entries plus one

question: Which of the following entrances does not require a switched outlet:

options.d: All of these require a switched outlet

question: Which of the following receptacles do not need to be grounded:

options.a: Receptacles located on an interior garage wall

correct_answer_text: None of the above (Technically all of these require grounding in modern code. The answer 'd' likely refers to 'None of the above' being the exception, or there's a specific older exception implied)

question: Each patient bed in a hospital critical care unit must have at least how many of the following:

options.c: 4 hospital-grade receptacles connected to an emergency system branch circuit

question: A receptacle installed to provide electric power to a recreational vehicle must comply with which of the following configurations:

options.a: 15 amps: 125 volt, 15 amperes, 2-pole, 4-wire grounding type for 120-volt system
options.b: 20 amps: 125 volt, 20 amperes, 3-pole, 4-wire grounding type for 120/240 volt system
options.c: 30 amps: 125 volt, 30 amperes, 2-pole, 4-wire grounding type for 120-volt system
options.d: 60 amps: 125 volt, 50 amperes, 3-pole, 4-wire grounding type for 120/240 volt system

correct_answer_text: 30 amps: 125 volt, 30 amperes, 2-pole, 3-wire grounding type (Note: Typical exam answer for 30A RV is the 125V 30A config)

question: Temporary electrical installations for holiday displays must be permanently removed after which of the following time periods:

options.d: 31 days after the end of the event

question: Requirements for patient beds located in critical care areas include which of the following:

options.a: The location must have at least two branch circuits.
options.b: The location must have one or more branch circuits from the emergency system and one or more from the normal power system.
options.c: At least one of the branch circuits on the emergency system has to supply an outlet at each individual bed location.

question: Wiring for cranes and hoists enclosed in raceways which shall be permitted to be which of the following type:

options.a: Type AC with insulated grounding conductors
options.c: Short lengths of exposed conductors to resistors and collectors

question: An electrically interconnected assembly of electrolytic cells that is supplied by a direct-current power source is known as which of the following:
Each resistive welder and control equipment shall be provided with which of the following:

options.c: A switch or circuit breaker power disconnection means

correct_answer_text: A switch or circuit breaker power disconnection means

question: Branch circuits and feeders for electric vehicle supply equipment shall have overcurrent protection that is rated to comply with which of the following:

options.a: Not less than 125% of the maximum load of the equipment
options.b: Not more than 125% of the maximum load of the equipment
options.c: Not less than 115% of the continuous load of the equipment
options.d: Not more than 118% of the maximum load of the equipment

correct_answer_text: Not less than 125% of the maximum load of the equipment

question: Power supply conductors for fire pumps shall meet which of the following requirements:

options.b: Connect directly to a listed fire pump controller
options.c: Be rated at 600 volts or more

correct_answer_text: Connect directly to a listed fire pump controller

question: For elevator cars, a separate branch circuit is required for which of the following power systems:
Supply conductors for industrial machinery shall have an ampacity no less than 125 percent of the full-load current of all resistance heating loads plus which of the following:

options.a: 125 percent of the full-load current rating of the highest rated motor
options.b: 125 percent of the full-load current rating of the highest rated motor plus the sum of the full-load current rating of all other connected motors based on duty cycles that may be in operation at the same time
options.c: 125 percent of the total current ratings of all other connected motors based on duty cycles that may be in operation at the same time

correct_answer_text: 125 percent of the full-load current rating of the highest rated motor plus the sum of the full-load current rating of all other connected motors based on duty cycles that may be in operation at the same time

question: If a normal power system fails, then the maximum delay allowed in a legally required emergency stand-by system before emergency power cuts on is which of the following:
correct_answer_text: 60 seconds (Note: 'Legally Required Standby' is 60s, 'Emergency' is 10s. Based on 'Legally required' phrase, 60s is standard)

question: If communications wiring is installed in a single-family home, which of the following requirements must be met:

options.a: The wiring system must be grounded
options.b: The grounding conductor cannot be smaller than 2.0 sq mm Copper
options.c: The length of the primary grounding conductor cannot exceed 6100 mm.

question: Communications wiring and cables cannot have a voltage rating over which of the following:
Antennas and lead-in conductors shall be which of the following materials:
Indoor antennas shall not run closer than which of the following to other wiring system conductors on the premises:

options.b: 60 mm if the other conductors are located in cable armor
options.d: 76 mm if the other conductors are located in a metal raceway

correct_answer_text: 60 mm if the other conductors are located in cable armor

question: If an outlet is in an underfloor raceway and is disconnected, then which of the following actions must be taken on the circuit conductors supplying the outlet:

options.a: A blank cover plate installed on the outlet box

question: Other than service conductors, conductors shall not be installed in the same service raceway unless they are which of the following:
Overcurrent devices in dwelling units and hotel guest rooms shall not be located in which of the following areas:
In order to balance a 3-wire, single-phase 230/115 volt circuit, which of the following must be done:

options.a: The neutral conductor must carry the unbalanced current.
options.b: The hot conductor must carry the total current.
options.c: The neutral conductor should be used for grounding only.

correct_answer_text: The neutral conductor must carry the unbalanced current.

question: In fixed electric space heating equipment, a disconnection means shall be provided from all ungrounded conductors to which of the following equipment components:
Computation of fluorescent fixture loads shall be based on which of the following:

options.a: The total ampere rating of the fixture
options.b: The total wattage of the lamps
options.c: The total volts of the wiring system

correct_answer_text: The total ampere rating of the fixture

question: A multiwire branch circuit may be used to supply which of the following:

options.a: A 120/240 volt system to one piece of utilization equipment
options.b: A 120/240 volt system where all conductors are opened simultaneously

question: Parallel conductors in each phase or neutral shall be which of the following:

options.a: The same length and terminated in the same manner

correct_answer_text: The same length and terminated in the same manner

question: The maximum number of overcurrent devices permitted in a lighting panel is which of the following:
Open conductors shall be supported on which of the following:

options.a: I or III (Glass/Porcelain knobs OR Strain insulators)
options.b: I or II (Glass/Porcelain knobs OR Racks/Brackets)
options.c: II or III (Racks/Brackets OR Strain insulators)

question: NM cable installations shall conform to which of the following:

options.a: It may be covered with plaster
options.b: It may be fished through air voids in masonry block or tile walls

correct_answer_text: It may be fished through air voids in masonry block or tile walls

question: The ampacity of multiconductor cables installed in a cable tray shall be derated based on which of the following:

options.a: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable
options.b: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable tray

correct_answer_text: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable tray

question: Switching should be done in which of the following:
Fuses must be clearly marked with which of the following:

options.c: Interruption rating, if other than 10,000 amperes

question: If a new office building has two service heads and will have only one service drop, then the maximum distance permitted between the service heads shall be which of the following:
Type FCC cables shall be clearly and permanently marked with which of the following:

An automatic overcurrent device that protects service conductors supplying a specific load, such as an electric water heater, shall be permitted to be locked or sealed in order to prevent which of the following:
A service mast used to support service drop conductors shall be supported by which of the following:
A transformer enclosure that extends directly to an underwater pool light and forms a shell must have which of the following:

options.c: The number of conduit entries plus one

correct_answer_text: The number of conduit entries plus one

question: Messenger supported wiring shall not be used for which of the following:

options.b: Where subjected to severe physical damage

question: Which of the following entrances does not require a switched outlet:

options.d: All of these require a switched outlet

question: All joints, splices and free ends of conductors shall have which of the following:

options.b: Insulation as thick as the conductor

question: Open motors with communicators shall be located so that any sparks cannot reach any combustible materials; however which of the following is also true:

options.a: This applies only to motors over 600 volts
options.b: This requirement shall not prohibit the motors from being on wooden floors
options.c: This does not prohibit these motors from being located in a Class 1 area

correct_answer_text: This requirement shall not prohibit the motors from being on wooden floors

question: Which of the following receptacles do not need to be grounded:

options.a: Receptacles located on an interior garage wall

correct_answer_text: All of the above (In context of 'None of the above' being intended but not listed, or if specifically referring to an older exception)

question: A feeder supplies a residential electric range and electric clothes dryer, and the maximum unbalanced load on the neutral conductor is considered to be which of the following percentages of the load on the ungrounded conductors:
Type FCC cable wiring systems shall be installed in which of the following:
All of the conductors in a multiwire branch circuit must meet which of the following requirements:
Which of the following identifying items of information is not required on a motor nameplate:
A single receptacle shall have a rating of which of the following:

options.a: 50 percent of the branch circuit rating
options.b: 100 percent of the branch circuit rating

correct_answer_text: 100 percent of the branch circuit rating

question: Safe access in the form of a permanent ladder shall be provided to the working spaces around electric equipment over 600 volts that is installed on or in which of the following:
Surge arresters shall meet which of the following requirements:

options.b: Shall be made inaccessible to unqualified persons

question: A general-use snap switch shall only be used to control which of the following on alternating current circuits:

options.a: Resistive loads that do not exceed the rating of the switch
options.b: Motor loads not in excess of 80% of the switch ampere rating
options.c: Inductive loads not exceeding the ampere rating of the switch

question: A controller that is not in sight of a motor location shall meet which of the following requirements:

options.a: Be capable of being shut off
options.b: Be connected to a bonding jumper
options.c: Be capable of being locked in the open position
options.d: Be capable of being set down in the off position

correct_answer_text: Be capable of being locked in the open position

question: The service conductors that run between the street main and the first point of connection to an underground service entrance are which of the following:
